The camera, from a slightly unsteady, handheld position above the water on a moving boat, maintains a level angle and uses a deep focus to keep the entire scene sharp. As the boat moves backward, the camera also moves backward, pans left, and tilts slightly up, shifting the view from the center of the canal to the buildings and a docked water bus on the left bank. As the camera moves, a docked white and light yellow vaporetto labeled "Actv 26" in the middle ground enters the frame from the left and moves out of frame from the right, carrying passengers. Various boats populate the scene, including a smaller wooden motorboat navigating the waterway. The pan concludes by revealing a large, ornate white church, the Basilica di Santa Maria della Salute, with wide stone steps leading down to a dock where other water buses are moored. This grand church occupies the left side of the frame in the middle ground. People can be seen on the boats and along the waterfront docks. There is no single main subject, as the shot is designed to immerse the viewer in the unique atmosphere and architectural scale of the Venetian environment, emphasizing the city's reliance on its canals.
